summary: This bill, the Nutrition Counseling Aiding Recovery for Eating Disorders Act of 2025 (or Nutrition CARE Act of 2025), amends Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide Medicare coverage for medical nutrition therapy (MNT) services for individuals with eating disorders. The bill defines MNT services and sets requirements, including a minimum of 13 hours of service in the first year and 4 hours annually thereafter. It addresses the high mortality rate and economic costs associated with eating disorders and explicitly includes the elderly population.
